        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a file cannot be accessed

      • download

        public void download(java.awt.Component parent,
                     Project project)
              throws java.io.IOException
        This attempts to download all elevation data for the given Project. This scans through the project, looking for Nodes with a recorded elevation of 0 (see Location.getElevation()). This method calls download(double, double) for each Node. To avoid throttling by Google Maps API, this method waits 1s after each download. If the connection is lost, any downloaded data will be recorded. If called again, this method will continue where it left off (because it looks for Nodes with 0 elevation).
        Parameters:
        parent - the component used to send JOptionPane message updates
        project - the Project
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a file cannot be accessed

      • download

        public static double download(double x,
                              double y)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Calls Google Maps API to download elevation for the given longitude and latitude. It is recommended not to call this too frequently due to throttling by Google Maps API.
        Parameters:
        x - the longitude
        y - the latitude
        Returns:
        the elevation from Google Maps API (ft)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the connection to Google Maps API cannot be made
